subject: Education
title: The Generation Effect: Create to Remember
description: A fast breakdown of The Generation Effect: Create to Remember for builders.

hook.text: Students who filled in blanks outperformed those who read complete sentences.

buildup.text: Passively receiving information requires less effortâ€”and produces weaker traces.

discovery.text: Generating an answer yourself forces deeper processing than just recognizing one.

twist.text: Even generating a wrong answer first improves later learning of the correct one.

climax.text: Any task that makes learners produce, not consume, taps the generation effect.

punchline.text: Struggle is the brain's favorite encoding tool.

quiz.question: Why does generating answers improve memory?
